Betti Numbers¶

homcv.betti_numbers.betti_numbers(image, threshold=0.5)¶

Computes the zeroeth and first Betti numbers of the “dark” region of a greyscale image.

Note that the second Betti number must be zero.

Parameters

  • image (ndarray, shape (nx, ny)) – Numpy array representing a greyscale image

  • threshold (float) – Number specifying the “data”

Returns

[betti_0, betti_1] – Zeroeth and first betti numbers of the regions of the image greater than the specified threshold.

Return type

ndarray, shape (2,)
